document_data.name: Myrkuth Longpipe
document_data.mainbody: '''Myrkuth Longpipe''', more commonly known as '''Ilph''', was a former [[thief]] and watchmen who served within the [[City Watch (Waterdeep)|City Watch]] of [[Waterdeep]] during the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Ilph was strong and thin for a [[halfling]]. He had black hair and favored black clothing when not wearing his watchman's uniform.
document_data.History:
During the mid-14{{th}} century Ilph was a sneak-thief who roamed the rooftops and delved within the sewers of Waterdeep. In his off time he frequented the taverns of the city's [[Dock Ward of Waterdeep|Dock Ward]].

Sometime during the [[1366 DR|Year of the Staff, 1366 DR]], Ilph was stashing some his ill-gotten loot in a hidden cache located in a hollowed-out stone block on the roof of the [[Palace of Waterdeep]], when he was stopped by one of Waterdeep's [[Lords of Waterdeep|Masked Lords]]. The lord chased the thief atop the city's building, keeping deft footing as well as Ilph, and eventually caught the criminal. Unbeknownst to Ilph, this lord was the newly-elected [[Nindil Jalbuck]].

Ilph was sentenced to six-years service within the City Watch. While he initially detested this new life that was forced upon him, by the [[1368 DR|Year of the Banner, 1368 DR]] he came to respect the Watch and enjoyed the attention and respect he garnered among his law enforcement comrades.
